results.title: Hyperandrogenism and menstrual imbalance are the best predictors of metformin response in PCOS patients

results.title: A Comparative Study of Luteinizing Hormone Levels in Polycystic Ovarian Syndrome With Hyperandrogenism: Metformin Versus Oral Contraceptive Pills
results.text_hl: The primary objective of the study was to compare the serum luteinizing hormone (LH) levels in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Hyperandrogenism</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D017588 @@@hyperandrogenism@@@ on @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ and combined oral contraceptive pills.

results.title: Hyperandrogenism? Increased 17, 20-Lyase Activity? A Metanalysis and Systematic Review of Altered Androgens in Boys and Girls with Autism
results.text_hl: As previously suggested, @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, which is already efficiently being used in @SPECIES_9606 @@@women@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Hyperandrogenism</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D017588 @@@hyperandrogenism@@@ due to @DISEASE_Polycystic_Ovary_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D011085 @@@PCOS@@@, reduces oxidative stress and @<m>DISEASE_Hyperandrogenism</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D017588 @@@hyperandrogenism@@@ and, as such, this might be one pharmacological target.

citations.NLM: Gasser BA, Buerki SF, Kurz J, Mohaupt MG. Hyperandrogenism? Increased 17, 20-Lyase Activity? A Metanalysis and Systematic Review of Altered Androgens in Boys and Girls with Autism Int J Mol Sci. 2021 Nov 15;22(22):. PMID: 34830216

results.title: Polycystic ovarian syndrome: signs and feedback effects of hyperandrogenism and insulin resistance.
results.text_hl: Therefore, we propose that treatment with @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ could decrease @DISEASE_Hyperinsulinism @DISEASE_MESH:D006946 @@@HI@@@ and consequently @<m>DISEASE_Hyperandrogenism</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D017588 @@@HA@@@, restoring, at least in part, the @DISEASE_Thyroid_Hormone_Metabolism_Abnormal @DISEASE_MESH:C566454 @@@metabolic and hormonal disorders@@@ of @DISEASE_Polycystic_Ovary_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D011085 @@@PCOS@@@.

results.title: The anti-androgenic effect of quercetin on hyperandrogenism and ovarian dysfunction induced in a dehydroepiandrosterone rat model of polycystic ovary syndrome.
results.text_hl: Our study revealed that @CHEMICAL_Glutamine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D005973 @@@Q@@@ is as effective as @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@MET@@@ in reducing @<m>DISEASE_Hyperandrogenism</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D017588 @@@hyperandrogenism@@@ via decreasing free T level and improving hypothalamic-pituitary-ovarian axis function.

citations.NLM: Mahmoud AA, Elfiky AM, Abo-Zeid FS. The anti-androgenic effect of quercetin on hyperandrogenism and ovarian dysfunction induced in a dehydroepiandrosterone rat model of polycystic ovary syndrome. Steroids. 2022 Jan;177():108936. PMID: 34752810
